Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of rosette with added red centres and added white outline; top of rim glazed; exterior: dot and billet pattern between pairs of lines at rim; below, painted decoration consisting of part of female figure's head, possibly wearing a red veil, to left.
Curator's comments: A number of Chian chalices from Emporio (Lemos no. 1468) and Rizari (Lemos no, 1487) depict komast dancers alongside female figures dressed in a long chiton and playing the double flute and tambourine (or possibly holding a wreath). Occasionally, the female figure is holding a pomegranate. On some chalices, the female figures are incised whilst on others they are depicted in outline. The figures on the sherds from Naukratis are likely to be from similar scenes interpreted as dancers following and performing with a chorus of women.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 286, no. 829, pl. 117)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1120) (phase 2)
Williams 1983 / Sophilos in the British Museum (p. 170)
